entry.title: Galaxy Australia tool updates 2020-03-03
entry.content:
The following tools have been installed/updated on Galaxy Australia

Annotation

  • snpeff was updated to 268d162b9c49
  • snpeff was updated to 5a29ab10dba6
  • snpeff was updated to 74aebe30fb52

    Assembly

  • bandage revision b2860df42e16 was installed
  • spades was updated to b8c00ce5dfa0

    Collection Operations

  • collapse_collections was updated to 33151a38533a
  • collapse_collections was updated to 830961c48e42

    EMBOSS

  • emboss_5 was updated to dba489bfcd62

    FASTA/FASTQ

  • fastp revision 1d8fe9bc4cb0 was installed

    FASTQ Quality Control

  • fastqc was updated to e7b2202befea
  • trim_galore was updated to 084bbd8ba7b8

    Get Data

  • ncbi_acc_download revision 1c58de56d587 was installed

    Mapping

    Metabolomics

    Metagenomic analyses

  • picrust_format_tree_and_trait_table revision 8ab93cd74444 was installed

  • picrust_normalize_by_copy_number revision 2e62e32d4f33 was installed
  • picrust_predict_metagenomes revision 49b6c4392fdc was installed

    Multiple Alignments

  • mafft was updated to 15974dd17515

    Phylogenetics

  • hyphy_gard revision 6283babe736e was installed
  • hyphy_absrel revision f73435dc282b was installed

    Picard

  • picard was updated to f6ced08779c4
  • picard was updated to a1f0b3f4b781

    SAM/BAM

  • samtools_fastx revision a8d69aee190e was installed
  • samtool_filter2 was updated to 649a225999a5
  • samtools_bedcov was updated to 9149ad20699a

    VCF/BCF

  • bcftools_annotate was updated to 8e01baf41774
  • bcftools_call was updated to 5801eff9ac7e
  • bcftools_cnv was updated to b2d1b7dda2b7
  • vcffilter was updated to fa24bf0598f4

    Variant Calling

  • lofreq_viterbi revision ecd80c7c3886 was installed
  • lofreq_call revision 03627f24605f was installed
  • freebayes was updated to ef2c525bd8cd
entry.summary: The following tools have been installed/updated on Galaxy Australia

entry.title: Galaxy Australia contributes to global research effort into COVID-19

link.title: Galaxy Australia contributes to global research effort into COVID-19

entry.content:
A joint paper by Galaxy teams from Australia, Europe and the United States demonstrated how the COVID-19 genome data can be shared, analysed and reproduced in an efficient and transparent way. Find the paper at https://www.biocommons.org.au/galaxy-covid-19 and the workflows ready for use here in Galaxy Australia under Shared Data / Workflows.

Galaxy Australia Team
entry.summary: A joint paper by Galaxy teams from Australia, Europe and the United States demonstrated how the COVID-19 genome data can be shared, analysed and reproduced in an efficient and transparent way. Find the paper at https://www.biocommons.org.au/galaxy-covid-19 and the workflows ready for use here in Galaxy Australia under Shared Data / Workflows.

entry.title: Galaxy Training Network - Survey
entry.content:
We need your input on preparing and giving Galaxy Training

Do you use Galaxy for Training? Then the Galaxy Training Network wants your feedback. Please take a few minutes to let us know about your training experiences.

The survey should take no more than 10 minutes and will help us prioritise improvements to the training materials. Weâ€™re currently focused on making it easier to prepare and give training.

Thank you!

The GTN Community
entry.summary: We need your input on preparing and giving Galaxy Training

entry.title: One millionth job!
entry.content: Galaxy Australia has now processed over 1 million jobs! The tool run for the one millionth job was DeepTools bam coverage and completed at 8:55am on Wednesday the 29th of January 2020.
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia has now processed over 1 million jobs! The tool run for the one millionth job was DeepTools bam coverage and completed at 8:55am on Wednesday the 29th of January 2020.

entry.title: Summer Holiday Support
entry.content: Galaxy Australia will be minimally administered during the university shutdown period from 24th December 2019 to the 2nd January 2020. During this time, only essential maintenance will be performed. No disk quota modifications, tool installations or reference data installation or upgrades will be performed.
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia will be minimally administered during the university shutdown period from 24th December 2019 to the 2nd January 2020. During this time, only essential maintenance will be performed. No disk quota modifications, tool installations or reference data installation or upgrades will be performed.

entry.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 19.09

link.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 19.09

entry.content:
Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 19.09.
This morning after a brief planned outage, Galaxy Australia was upgraded to the latest version of Galaxy. You will notice some changes straight away - The tool menu is a bit easier to read now. Everything else is the same however!

This release includes:

  • Workflow reporting
  • New visualisations
  • Cleaner history menu

Please see the user release notes for additional information.

Alternatively, see the full release notes
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 19.09. This morning after a brief planned outage, Galaxy Australia was upgraded to the latest version of Galaxy. You will notice some changes straight away - The tool menu is a bit easier to read now. Everything else is the same however!

entry.title: Nanopore tools installed
entry.content:
Nanopore tools installed
Galaxy Australia has been updated with a new set of tools for processing Nanopore data. The tools include:

  • Poretools
  • Porechop
  • Nanoplot
  • Canu
  • Flye
  • Nanopolish

The majority of Nanopore tools are located under Genomic File Manipulation - Nanopore, except for the assemblers (Flye and Canu) which are in Assembly.

Other tools to support Nanopore data will be installed soon.
entry.summary: Nanopore tools installed Galaxy Australia has been updated with a new set of tools for processing Nanopore data. The tools include:

entry.title: Australian BioCommons Data Survey
entry.content:
Calling all Australian life science researchers who move data!
The Australian BioCommons is a new NCRIS-funded digital capability that will enhance national bioinformatics infrastructure for environmental, agricultural and biomedical researchers. We want to know about your research data movement challenges.

Please help inform us so that we can improve bioinformatics infrastructure and resources nationally by completing our 10 minute survey on data movement.

Survey here: https://forms.gle/35RsqUYi1jnMxp9W9

Follow Australian BioCommons at @AusBioCommons
entry.summary: Calling all Australian life science researchers who move data! The Australian BioCommons is a new NCRIS-funded digital capability that will enhance national bioinformatics infrastructure for environmental, agricultural and biomedical researchers. We want to know about your research data movement challenges.
